Posts.Content: ArizonaGirl1972 wrote: I am a 40 year old that was advised to go for a basal mammo on April 24th.  I was called the next day to be informed they needed me to go back.  I went for a second mammo with ultrasound on May 1st.  On May 8th I was seen by a surgeon who advised biopsies would be needed for two findings in my left breast.  On May 16th I had my biopsies.  One was tagged with a little lock (the radiologist stated it was fatty tissue) and the other with a cancer ribbon (the radiologist never talked about what he was finding). On May 20th I called my surgeon's office and was told the results on both areas were negative and that she would have the doctor read the results to advise me when I would need to do my follow up.  I was called this morning from my surgeon's office and was told an MRI is needed since the biopsy results were inconsistant with the ultrasound results.  I am completely scared.  I am also now wondering if they will need to do another biopsy. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Biopsy now MRI ArizonaGirl1972 ArizonaGirl1972
